meanings.definition: The destruction or loss of a ship at sea.
meanings.sent1: The shipwreck left the sailors stranded on a deserted island.
meanings.sent2: The news of the shipwreck spread quickly throughout the coastal town.
meanings.sent3: The shipwreck was so unexpected, it almost seemed like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams lay in ruins, like a shipwreck on the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: The shipwreck was a haunting reminder of the dangers of the sea.

meanings.definition: To cause a ship to be destroyed or lost at sea.
meanings.sent1: The stormy weather could shipwreck even the sturdiest vessels.
meanings.sent2: The pirate captain plotted to shipwreck his rival's fleet.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate through the dense fog could easily shipwreck inexperienced sailors.
meanings.sent4: His reckless actions threatened to shipwreck their chances of reaching the port safely.
meanings.sent5: The treacherous rocks near the shore could shipwreck any ship that strayed too close.

meanings.definition: A ship that has been destroyed or lost at sea.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed artifacts recovered from the ancient shipwreck.
meanings.sent2: Divers explored the depths in search of the sunken shipwreck.
meanings.sent3: The old sailor claimed to have seen a ghostly crew aboard the haunted shipwreck.
meanings.sent4: The shipwreck served as a somber memorial to those who perished at sea.
meanings.sent5: Legends spoke of a cursed treasure hidden within the mysterious shipwreck.
